content.description: Great line up the obvious steep arete. Small edges and rails hold your attention as you climb delicately to the top and a nice hold. There is a sit start option as well. Consensus is V5.
content.location: Right as you approach the boulder to the right of the tall finger crack.

content.description: Climb the right to left facing crack. Start at the  beginning of the crack and climb straight up on small edges to get established. Using the small edge of the crack and smart feet continue to traverse left high off the ground until the shelf. Go straight up at that point. There is a V6 variation which starts at Filling the Void and follows the shelf into the crack.
content.location: Obvious right to left facing crack.

content.description: Climb the tall finger and hand crack left of the arete. A tricky press gains the crack. Get some good locks and make a few moves to good jams. Try not to look down.
content.location: Left of the arete as you approach the boulder.

content.description: This is a boulder off the beaten path. However a bit easier to get to than the Sherman Boulder. The boulder is a bit tall and requires a few pads. Worth the visit as it has some quality lines. If it was at either of the main areas it would see a lot of traffic.   After meandering around the park for many years it was awesome to stumble upon this, well in my eyes, gem. After quite a bit of scrubbing and flake exfoliation the rock is climbable and well textured. Obvious caution should be used as the boulder is fairly tall.
